website_summaries.verdict: If you've been waiting a couple of years to upgrade your $200 video card, the Nvidia GeForce GTX 660 is an attractive choice that nonetheless faces strong competition from similarly priced AMD products.
pros: Decent performance for the price, even at higher resolutions
Introduces Kepler technologies to the mainstream market
cons: Not decisively faster than similarly priced AMD cards in many tests
Power usage higher than that of competitors

customer_reviews.title: EVGA GTX 660
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this used for $80 where the MSRP is $220. A very good deal for a very good card. Anyways, this thing is amazing. Running a 1920x1200 monitor and Athlon X4 760K, I can run games like Fallout 4 and Planetside 2 at 40-60 FPS easily, without too much compromise (I like turning off shadows and lighting, but cranking up texture resolution). Older or less intensive games like This card is still very good. It's roughly equivalent to a GTX 750ti, and requires 1 PCI-e 6-pin connector. It's not loud nor does it run very hot. My hard drives are louder than this at idle.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a great card!
customer_reviews.text: Had to reroute some of my wiring, but nothing earth shattering. While on the low end of the GeForce graphics card options, this GTX 660 overclocked easily has enough juice to take care of my MMORPG gaming. I'm glad, for now at least, that I didn't go with the latest generation. I would never have gotten a return on my investment!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: 6 years later, still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: The card has age and cant keep up with modern games, but still works great for what it can do. Had a minor overheating issue not long ago. Turned out just had to replace the paste on the heat sink. But other than that, under heavy use for 6 years nearly every day, and still works just fine, exceptional card. Used for gaming, 3d animation, and video editing work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great performance for the money
customer_reviews.text: I installed this graphics card in my first Hackintosh / CustoMac build and hooked it up to DVI and HDMI displays without any issues. The graphics quality is great when gaming, and everything is fast and super-smooth when image editing or designing. The best part is that even though this card has more than enough power for my needs, it is still very affordable. CPU: Motherboard: GPU: EVGA GeForce GTX 660 Superclocked 2GB RAM: 2 x SSD: 2 x HDD: 2 x PSU: Case: OS: Dual booting Mac OS X 10.9 Mavericks & Windows 8.1
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Hardcore gaming on a casual budget
customer_reviews.text: Here's a GPU that's a few generations old, so the price is nice and low. That said, the superclocking isn't just a gimmick, it really seems to make a difference. Playing games with my friends/guilds, I have settings that match theirs, and they're using the GTX 9xx series. I don't get quite the FPS they do, and I do have to dial back some of the more frivolous settings (certain shadows, NVidia hairworks, etc), but it gets the job done. If you've got the money for a more current gen card, definitely go that route, but if you're looking to game on a budget, this is a great solution.
customer_reviews.author: Warlocc

customer_reviews.title: SLI Beast.
customer_reviews.text: I already had one and wanted to use this in SLI. Although it is a fairly old card it still can run anything I throw at it at 60 fps, ultra/extreme graphics settings @ 1920/1080 res. Cards run fairly low temp. In SLI with one PCI slot in between the cards the bottom card is usually around 75' with the top card usually around 80' (running benchmark software for an hour). I would recommend if you already have one and an SLI compatible motherboard. Otherwise, I would recommend a EVGA GTX 960 SSC AX 2.0+.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Great Card!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the GTX 660 SC new here on Amazon. When I opened it up, the card had minor wear and scratches on the edges, signs of a used card. Although this card was not brand new, it works like a dream! The scratches don't hinder its performance :P The case badge was not included since it was not brand new :( My build that I put this in does not have an optical drive, but I was able to rip the files from the driver disc and put them onto a flash drive using my laptop. I would definitely recommend this graphics card, hands down! Awesome bang for the buck! "NVIDIA, the way it's meant to be played."
customer_reviews.author: ricq

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: My son and I built a gaming/family computer a couple of years ago. Price being an issue we skimped a bit on the video card. We recently bought this one to replace it. My son wanted the 7 series but that was another hundred bucks and since price is still a factor we got this one instead. The difference between this and what we had (ZOTAC nVidia GeForce 9800GT B-Hawk 512 MB DDR3 VGA/DVI/HDMI PCI-Express Video Card ZT-98GES5P-FDL) is night and day. If you are a heavy duty gamer and have the money you can do better than this. If you are on a budget but still want pretty amazing graphics this one would be a good way to go.
customer_reviews.author: mstephe51

customer_reviews.title: Does everything I need it to
customer_reviews.text: Plays all my current games SC2, Bioshock Inifinite, XCOM, on very high settings at 1080p. Price for performance was just right. No complains other than the packaged games, which at the time I bought it was credits towards free to play games. Card replaced an older EVGA 9800GTX card that was still going strong although a bit dated. Very happy with EVGA's reliability in the past. I really like NVIDIAs Gefore Experience software which works with any of the newer cards. It auto configures the best settings I can expect with this card in many of the games I own so I don't have to fiddle with video settings to get the best graphics with a smooth frame rate.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L

customer_reviews.title: Dream Card
customer_reviews.text: If you're into gaming and you just want to play video games or watch ultra high quality movies or videos, get one of these. At this price, you cannot go wrong. I've been playing Skyrim, Tomb Raider, The Walking Dead: Survival Instinct, Assassin's Creed, Crysis 3...and more on ULTRA HIGH graphics mode. Note: Be sure to have a power supply with the right connectors and at least 25Amps. I'm using a Cooler Master 600W, find it here -
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and epic
customer_reviews.text: The Graphics Card is excellent. Runs very well on a Grand theft Auto 5 getting 1080p 60 FPS the bad side its more power so you need a 500 or more watts psu. But the also great advantage you get free updates to your GPU for all of you minecraft Fans the GRAPHICS card will be perfect for you running you around 500 or more FPS Cons.. Its huge but it should fit. More power unless you have 500 or more watts. Hope this should help you.
customer_reviews.author: Kamil K

customer_reviews.title: Great Card great price
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace the gtx 650 in my its build. This card works great and I love the rear exhaust, which helps alot in my build. The only con to this card is that I didn't get all the accessories shown in the picture, all I got was the evga badge (I wanted the stickers!!) My build is an EVGA Hadro Air, I5 3570k, gtx 660 and 8 GB ram. All in all its a great card I'd say about 2x a noticible difference between this and a 650.
customer_reviews.author: BetterthanBatman

customer_reviews.title: Yep
customer_reviews.text: Great card for a good price. All the techies have already given you their FPS and gameplay observations and I agree. This is the card you want if gameplay performance is important yet you don't want to spend $$$$ for the ultimate card only to have it become obsolete in 6 months. I prefer the Nvidia stuff over AMD and for stuff like WOW and Skyrim this card gets it done. The bonus game Splinter Cell is a download that failed to activate and uses a Steamlike player supported in Sweden. Useless so I gave up on it. Maybe you can get game and player to work for you but good luck...
customer_reviews.author: JimmyM

customer_reviews.title: great card
customer_reviews.text: I am running 3 monitors with this thing and I've played everything from Crysis 3 to World of Warcraft on maxed settings and it hasn't given me any problems. love it. I thought I got a dud at first because Farcry 3 kept blacking out my computer, but it turned out to be my fault. One of the computer wires was creating a drag on the cooling fan underneath the card, causing it to overheat. Once I removed the wire, all was right in the world.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price/performance
customer_reviews.text: The GTX 6-series of cards are top performers overall, at their price points. This superclocked card from EVGA is no exception. Excellent price/performance, Win7 64-bit drivers, and compatibility with all top games to my knowledge. My daughter used it as part of a system upgrade: installed without problem. Note that nVidia's latest drivers contain pre-sets for most of the top RPG and online games so that you easily tweak the card to make sure you get best performance and game play. Requires less power and is quieter than the GTX 5-series.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I loved it, but...
customer_reviews.text: I loved it, but... It was hell when I replaced the old nVidia card and put the two new cards in SLI configuration. In the beginning the operating system did not recognize the cards at all... After a while I stopped swearing at it, and I removed all traces of the old nVidia driver. I just re-installed the nVidia driver (the same I was using before replacement, original from the nVidia site) and then it worked like a charm. I'm still figuring out the CUDA performance running benchmarks.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ehmig

customer_reviews.title: Great Card for Your Dollar!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, it is very quiet and you can play Battlefield 3 and Skyrim with everything set at maximum. I have a Q6600 Core Duo Quad Core processor running at 2.4 GHz and 4 Gigs of RAM, with this combination this is a great running card. If you have a i5 or i7 it will work even better. You do need at least a 450 Watt PSU, I have a 500 Watt and it runs everything with no problem. My only question is will it run Battlefield 4 and Call of Duty: Ghost? We'll just have to wait and see. Nonetheless, it is a great video card and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: HTPC
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these to put in my new gaming HTPC build which is built around the EVGA hadron case. This card fits great in that little case, and it runs silent for when we are watching movies on the HTPC. In gaming, it works great at 1080p, and is able to handle anything I have thrown at it so far. There is a lot of performance here for the money, and as a long time AMD Radeon user I am impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Norma Stitz

customer_reviews.title: Works great on Mac
customer_reviews.text: Works great in my 8-core Power Mac 3,1. I wish it was Mac native, but it works just fine once the boot up has completed. The screen is dark through the initial boot phase, but comes alive at login. The only problem with that is if there is an issue at boot time; then it is hard to debug, and it would be nice to have a second graphics board ( that does not need more power than the PCIe bus can support, because there is only one easily accessible power cable) with a second monitor for that.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kaczkowski

customer_reviews.title: Overheats quickly and restarts the PC when playing games
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card to play games, and I also bought the KingWin 750 watts power supply. It will run the PC with light load at 40 - 50 degrees Celsius, but as soon as a game is loaded (Skyrim or Arma2) the card will start building heat. After a few minutes it reaches 80 c, 90 c and finally at 100 c+ it kills the PC. This takes just 3-5 minutes. It did come with some nice software, instructions, and updating driver was easy from their website. I will be returning this card and getting the Gigabyte version.
customer_reviews.author: Rdoul

customer_reviews.title: unlike the one i got from ebay that had terrible packaging which led to the fan coming off
customer_reviews.text: it came in working perfectly, unlike the one i got from ebay that had terrible packaging which led to the fan coming off. This works great and looks really new(got a refurbished one). Still is a champ for builds, does get a lil hot tho. use proper cooling fans to cool down pc.
customer_reviews.author: E-Man

customer_reviews.title: By far my favorite computer part thus far.
customer_reviews.text: The design of this thing isn't flashy by any means and the price is reasonable but the speed of it is incredible. My friend runs dual 770s and couldn't believe it when I told him I was holding a steady 70 frames per second on BF4. I have this gpu paired with an intel i5 quad core and my pc is a hauss. Love it and would definitely recommend to anyone looking for performance at a cheaper price.
customer_reviews.author: Blake London

customer_reviews.title: Best 200-bucks ever spent!!!
customer_reviews.text: Having wanting to play my PC games on higher settings without any major lagging issues, I needed a decent graphics card to make it happen. But after installing this into my PC, it's allowed me to max-out every single game I have on their highest settings and still manages to run butter-smooth in the process. So if anyone is looking for an excellent GPU, but is somewhat tight on a budget, the EVGA GTX660 works wonders (but have at least a 450-watt PSU to support it however).
customer_reviews.author: pyroguy

customer_reviews.title: may be a good card but not for my system...
customer_reviews.text: Lot of display driver crashes with this card. Granted, it may not be the card but my old HP workstation but somehow they don't work together well and also I cannot use my x16 PCIE slot because th card is incompatible with it for some odd reason. I like the power but the frequent card resetting is disappointing and irritating. And no it is not the Nvidia drivers, which were updated 3 times since I had the card.
customer_reviews.author: magusat999

customer_reviews.title: Love the Card
customer_reviews.text: I love this card. Easy manual install; however, they do not have the drivers for windows 8, at least the x64, on the disc that comes with the card. It took awhile to figure out where to get the driver from and had to download it since it is not recognized by the windows plug and play feature. If you are installing it go to EVGA to get the driver, that will save you some time. But all in all its a great device. plus uses less power than my old gtx260 that I replaced with this one. All in all pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: For a card that is under $200 at the time of writing this is a great deal. When I bought this, there was a fantastic sale, where I got 2 free games (Both of which were games that I like; Assassins creed Black flag and splinter cell). Even without them I think this is a solid buy. This card could easily go max settings on assassins creed IV which is a current gen game, and it was really nice seeing just how much this card could do.
customer_reviews.author: Gatlin

customer_reviews.title: Not for the really demanding games, but will handle most everything else
customer_reviews.text: To be fair, some of the most demanding games seem to need 2 (or even 3) graphics cards to yield an enjoyable FPS rate. For the rest of us, this will *probably* suffice. FYI, I bought this mainly to run Civilization 5, thinking that it would be overkill, but it still couldn't handle the game when on the very highest resolution. Not the card's fault, as it turns out Civ 5 is an infamous resource hog. Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: I've had the card for 2 months now and it works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I really did my research with this card (being an avid gamer and all) and found out it was the best card in the price/performance ratio. So far the most demanding game I've played is Far Cry 3 with it and it runs like a charm with every graphic option at the hightest!. Batman Arkahm City (which is also a very graphic demanding game) runs very smooth also with every graphic option at its maximum. If you're on a tight budget then for 200$ this card is the best choice around.
customer_reviews.author: Son Goku

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: this video card is perfect for the light to moderate gamer! I play borderlands 2 and this card runs everything maxed without any issues or lag. it is cooler running and uses less power then my old ATI hd 4700 series card that it replaced. couldn't be happier with my purchase(unless I could have afforded a second one)! only issue with this card is the CRAPPY ontrac shipping. they tried to deliver my package to my work at 8 pm three hours after we closed. this card is so good I can overlook the crappy shipper.
customer_reviews.author: T. Dingman

customer_reviews.title: Great Card
customer_reviews.text: I used this to upgrade an older Intel I5 PC to a gaming rig. Used in conjunction with several SATA HDDs, and 12GB of RAM, it turned out very well. I was very impressed with the frame rates and consistency of this video card. It made the biggest difference in the success of the PC. In comparrison benchmarking, the PC scored equivalent to I7 and higher end PCs. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Very good.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, even with marginal knowledge of computers. Registration and online driver and other online features was easy to access and obtain. Without getting deep into the inner workings of FPS, benchmarking, etc., and going into forums, it seems that an introductory area is needed for a user with lesser knowledge of video cards who may want to upgrade to higher standards and would like to expand their knowledge of what this and that is.
customer_reviews.author: Blue & Ego

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price vs performance
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up to hold me over until I can afford a 770, I'll have to say this card is excellent. I currently have it paired with an intel I7 3820 16 gigs of Hyper X and an ASUS P9X79 and the card it outperforming my expectations; it kills Battlefield 3 and Metro last light, not to mention just about every other game on the market, while Physx performance leaves a little to be desired it's an amazing budget card.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Best budget video card you can buy
customer_reviews.text: Best budget video card you can buy. I can throw all games at this GTX 660 and do max settings quality-wise and go half to all the way on MSAA/TXAA settings, all with 40+ fps. This was a huge boost over my 650 Ti. Card runs cool and hasn't had any issues. I play Far Cry 3 and Tomb Raider on Max settings with Anti-Aliasing half way throttled. Great card, would not buy anything lower than it if you want a high quality gaming build.
customer_reviews.author: Owen

customer_reviews.title: Performance and value
customer_reviews.text: Echoing what many have said here, this is a terrific card. Small enough to fit most PCs, only requires 1 power connection from the PSU, runs quiet and relatively cool. I installed the card in a new HP Pavilion HPE h8-1360t, i7-3770K/8GB/600W PSU/W7 Pro (from an OEM disk, no need for all that HP garbage!) that came with a woefully inadequate GT 630 card as the only option. I use Flight Simulator X, which while CPU-bound still requires a decent graphics card. The GTX 660 is a great match for the CPU, the sim runs as well as I've ever seen it run. Like the title says, performance and value, very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: exmixer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I don't regret buying this card. It is very well made, runs great, and is pretty quiet. It also works almost flawlessly in a Mac (with boot camp and Windows 7), however the screen will be black until login. I would recommend this to someone who wants a graphics card that is powerful enough to run any modern game well, and is still practical. It is also very easy to install in a Mac Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Justin R.

customer_reviews.title: however the cooler is not the best out there but it works well in removing heat ...
customer_reviews.text: Have this card approximately 2 years now and never let me down,however the cooler is not the best out there but it works well in removing heat from your case,which is highly beneficial ,i replaced the stock cooler with this  .This drop temps dramatically down to 30 idle and 55 max,however this card deserves 5 stars for its impressive performance and durability.
customer_reviews.author: adrian

customer_reviews.title: Looks good to me
customer_reviews.text: I know jack crap about graphics cards other than there are many better ones on the market than this. This, however, was plenty for my needs, and so I jumped on this price point. The deducted star reflects that there are better products out there. I'm not a gamer, but if you are, you should probably get a more expensive one.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Awesome performance for a fraction of the cost of higher end cards
customer_reviews.text: Paired with anthis card can pretty much do it all. Skyrim, Hitman: Absolution, Borderlands 2, Crysis 3, all at the MAX settings, run great! Just for reference, my CPU is anoverclocked to 4.3 GHz, and I have the card plugged into a PCIe 3.0 x16 slot. I would DEFINITELY recommend this to anyone who is into gaming, but doesn't want to spend a fortune on the latest generation of graphics cards.
customer_reviews.author: ThaKevMan

customer_reviews.title: Works great on 2008 Mac Pro running Mavericks
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace a dying video card on an early 2008 Mac Pro (3.0) currently running OS 10.9.5. The installation was seamless and the card worked perfectly first time. The only change you will see is that you do not get the Apple logo screen at start up, so don't worry - just wait a moment and the startup will continue. You will need a 6 pin-6 pin cable to power the card. Not all 6 pin-6 pin cables are the same, but this one worked fine for my Mac:
customer_reviews.author: Andy Groves

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfull card!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very powerful card. It performs very well and with the diverse amount of ports on the back it can output to many types of monitors. Although a word of caution to anyone wanting to use more than one monitor, you will want to get something more powerful, because when you double the screens, you halve the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Babe

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This card replaced a pair of 8800 GTXs in SLI. One had failed, the other was getting a random BSOD. This card worked great for just under 6 months before failing (Earlier this week). Since I work from home, it was a little more destructive than most typical hardware failure so I can't say I would order another EVGA card but I'm hoping that I can get it warrantied at least...
customer_reviews.author: J. Metcalf

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for gaming. I still run into FPS issues with some games, but with games like BF4, i can play those with out a hitch on the highest graphical setting. Very pleased with it. Runs quite, dependable, and all around a good product if you aren't looking for the latest and greatest.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement Video Card
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this video card to replace the OEM video card in my new Dell I7 desktop (it came with a SLOW OEM video card). The installation was easy and took about 10 minutes. I turned on my computer and everything worked great. What a difference this video card makes. It is very quiet and performs excellent. I can play any PC game (including Crysis) with no issues. I am very pleased with this card and recommend it to anyone who wants to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: lamahug

customer_reviews.title: and whats nice about it is that the seller offers a 1yr ...
customer_reviews.text: This card came in on time and packaged well, and whats nice about it is that the seller offers a 1yr warranty on it also. This card replaced an AMD R7 250x from power color and I have no complaints with it other than it doesnt make my coffee. If you are looking for a good card for a decent price, this would be a go to option.
customer_reviews.author: douglas futrell

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Performance
customer_reviews.text: Make sure your PC case is big enough for this card and your Power supply is adequate, it is very long and takes up 2 slots. Also there is a few technical issues if you are upgrading your card from previous versions on some machines. If your Windows boots up then PC switches off at or before logon screen, restart in Safe Mode. Remove all traces of Nvidia drivers and the Install folder (see nvidia.com) and restart PC.
customer_reviews.author: Lorena Cardoza

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: For around $200, you get a card that supports up to 4 monitors. I replaced an older GEFORCE 460. It significantly improves the quality of the graphics both in the Windows 8 environment and in games. My graphics sits at 7.9 now on the Windows Experience Index. (It was 7.1) I use it for gaming and software development. Great performance for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Gifford

customer_reviews.title: A great card for a gamer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about a week ago and wanted to give a quick opinion for those wondering if this card is for them. First off, this card plays Skyrim, Dragon age, Neverwinter Nights 2, and more all at their highest settings. Price vs performance is unbeatable. The install however, was very frustrating. This is not the cards fault but I had to root around in the BIOS, disable intel's graphics driver ext. Also, and this help me greatly, be sure your not plugging your computer into a full power strip. If it powers on and off a few times to a blank screen, you may not have enough power. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I've had this card for several months now with no issues. It has a little electrical whine (high high pitch) but only under load. I'm confident that that card will be around for the long term though. EVGA is great like that. Also, don't forget to register your card on evga's website so you can take advantage of the good warranties.
customer_reviews.author: Zach M Moore

customer_reviews.title: I had my local best buy Geek Squad team hook it up for me
customer_reviews.text: Totally worth the money! This thing is a beast. I have a HP pavilion desk top. i had AMD graphics, I upgraded my PSU (power supply unit) to a 600w. This will run any game you throw at it on high/ultra settings. I had my local best buy Geek Squad team hook it up for me. No charge.
customer_reviews.author: Shanny

customer_reviews.title: wow
customer_reviews.text: smooth like a b(*&& \.... loving every minute of it... working with Corsair Vengeance 8 GB ( 2 x 4 GB ) DDR3 1600 MHz (PC3 12800) 240-Pin DDR3... WD Blue 1 TB Desktop Hard Drive: 3.5 Inch, 7200 RPM, SATA 6 Gb/s, 64 MB... AMD FD6300WMHKBOX FX-6300 6-Core Processor Black Edition cant complain
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use the higher level of graphics in Skyrim and this card allowed it and has more. The install was simple and I was able to get running very quickly. No problems with recognition and operations. I'm very happy with this card for the quality graphic I allows with no speed impact.
customer_reviews.author: C. Smiley

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Nvidia
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, this thing screams, I know there are newer faster ones out there but this is lots of bang for the buck, it is great with Flight simulator X. Also check out FSXGenius's You tube videos to tweak your system for max performance
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome video card
customer_reviews.text: I love this video card, I have two of them installed in my game system using SLI. Great performance for the price. I also highly appreciate that its fan pushes the heat out of the case via the card's rear vent, instead of sending it into the system's case.
customer_reviews.author: Don Joslyn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gaming card, some temperature problems.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a gaming build. It's powerful enough to handle most games at high graphics settings. I have been very happy with it for the most part. About 8 months after purchasing, I noticed that it was running very hot, and it started overheating and cutting out. Tried putting on new thermal paste, which didn't help. I boughtand that solved the problem, so stock fan and heat sink not fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Great Video Card
customer_reviews.text: I built a computer with the AMD FX-8350, 4 GHZ 8 Core processor and the EVGA GeForce GTX 66 2048MB GDDR5 Video card. The computer has 8Gbs of G-Skill RipJaw X-series RAM. The computer is completely stable and operates very fast. No issues running any games, I have completely enjoyed this video card.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde A. Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first video card I installed on my own, usually my BF does it for me so I was nervous. It was super easy to install and has been working great! Very quiet and doesn't seem to be overheating at all even when gaming for long periods of time. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dierdra McGill

customer_reviews.title: my son seems to love it
customer_reviews.text: i can't get my son's ass off the computer since he put this thing in its just video games all the time! he says it is terrific and he should know
customer_reviews.author: gata

customer_reviews.title: its really good
customer_reviews.text: without having anything very technical to say.. as part of a sort-of mid cost build, this has performed wonderfully. if your buying a new "budget" card today, don't go any lower than this very solid choice, but get the Ti version if you can. nothings gone wrong yet but i know if it did, evga has my back
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Very fast for the price
customer_reviews.text: This thing will play all the latest games at 1080p resolution with full detail, especially when combined with my GTX260 for PhysX processing. I am very happy with the performance and it runs completely quiet which is a far cry from the GTX260 which sounds like a dust buster when it's running at full load.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Perez

customer_reviews.title: Problems
customer_reviews.text: Ok so i bought the card thinking that i would not have to upgrade very,very soon. That was a lie a day after i got the card the display driver crashed so i re-installed the drivers did not work. So i read some reviews and I underclocked it did not work. So I was getting pretty mad and then I saw someone with the same problem and it was over heating. Soo i do no advise you to buy this card . You can but a better one with better cooling for the same price
customer_reviews.author: Adam Serdula

customer_reviews.title: Smooth Sailing
customer_reviews.text: One of the most trouble free board installations I can recall. I have no need to play much with overclocking since I play WoW. Do see a nice improvement in fps ... fairly steady 60 but can go higher. The supplied EVGA software is a nice addition to the NVIDIA basics. EVGA delivers a nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: have 2 of these sli linked, and it is more than enough for ultra setting on even the most taxing games i have. saints row three doesnt even bring on the fans. planetside 2 is handled with ease. 1 is all you need
customer_reviews.author: Josephdalepi

customer_reviews.title: Nice GPU
customer_reviews.text: My case is designed for a blower type gpu, so i choose this one, is great, very handy, reliable and well made, the temperatures are manageable, and the overclock software is easy to operate, right now im playing the withcer 2, in high settings, no cons at all.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno Ortiz Estupi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Loved the card! Awesome service. They were very nice. They helped out when I didnt get the original box, and they sorted it all out. Also refunded the shipping cost. Would buy again. The card had been running strong. I play bf4 on high with my ancient pc. Gives it another 1 year on it. Which should be perfect timing for me saving up to finally get my new build on the way
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, it took me a while to complete the computer build...so I could not write a review for this product sooner. However, it works incredible. With my MoBo I could not connect an SLI bridge and add another card like I wanted to. But, so far seeing very nice results with just one card.
customer_reviews.author: Student of Wisdom

customer_reviews.title: I love this card.
customer_reviews.text: I love this graphic card! I can play high end games in the highest picture formats plus watch 3D Blu-Ray movies on my pc if you have a screen that supports the 3D formats. I have had no problems at all and the card is SLI Ready so if you bought a second one it auto run the same formats saved from the first card onto the second.
customer_reviews.author: Prod1gyX

customer_reviews.title: Great Card for the price
customer_reviews.text: I recently built a new computer and the first graphics card I bought kept having driver issues. For example monitor flickering and freezing. I sent back the card through amazon and got refunded quickly and bought this card as a replacement. This card arrived quickly and was incredibly easy to install right out of the box. In about 10 minutes from opening the box I was playing all my games on Max setting with great frame-rate and the card runs very quiet. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Its been great
customer_reviews.text: Not a gamer, I'm a videographer. Good entry level GPU. Easy instal and no issues working. So far been pretty quiet but I haven't completely put it through its paces yet. i dont believe in benchmarks so I'll update again when I get some real world data.
customer_reviews.author: N. Hedgeman

customer_reviews.title: The card came out of a server so it didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: The card came out of a server so it didn't have original box, documentation or software. After installing it and downloading the software it runs perfectly. If I needed another I'd buy one without hesitation,
customer_reviews.author: Dale D. Neymeyer

customer_reviews.title: Great video card
customer_reviews.text: I love this video card. Be sure that when you're getting a better video card that you're not bottlenecking with your processor. I was getting a steady 60 fps on BF3 on high with an AMD six core processor at 3.6 ghz, I upgraded to an 8 core at 4 ghz (which oddly came over clocked to 4.3) and now I can run bf3 on high from a low of 80 fps to a high of 140. Love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Works nice with Adobe Premiere
customer_reviews.text: I have had no problems with this guy. I use it for doing video editing in Adobe Premiere CS6, and after modifying the adobe supported graphics cards file on my computer..... I can now get live Hardware previews while editing video. Woooooo!
customer_reviews.author: Northerner

customer_reviews.title: This graphics card installed very easily! The only problem I had is that I ...
customer_reviews.text: This graphics card installed very easily! The only problem I had is that I think my HD cable is bad. When I tried to use it, it said 'check signal cable' so I'm stuck with digital till I can get to Best Buy to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: MsTaterHed

customer_reviews.title: Still running strong!
customer_reviews.text: I have been gaming with this card every day for almost 9 months and it has not given me any problems at all. I can max my settings on Rift, WoW, and Planetside 2 (with PhysX) and never have frame rate problems. Runs about 75C after a few hours of intense gaming, but other than that it runs cool. I plan to grab another one of these for SLI or upgrade this model... either way, I will be sticking with an EVGA for my next card.
customer_reviews.author: JCC

customer_reviews.title: GTX 660 2-Way SLI
customer_reviews.text: Great cards, however be aware on the nVidia website it says you can connect up to 3 of these cards for 3-Way SLI, but that is not the case, these can only be 2-Way SLI, look at the image of the front of the box, it also shows 2-Way SLI there too.
customer_reviews.author: Joe R.

customer_reviews.title: product of very good quality, 100% satisfied with your purchase recommend this ...
customer_reviews.text: product of very good quality, 100% satisfied with your purchase recommend this product to all my friends and customers amazon demanded of such items.
customer_reviews.author: antonio manuel

customer_reviews.title: Booyah
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet. I thought it was broke after upgrading my HD 7700 XFX to this graphics card. It is long though. Just a word of caution to those with mini cases.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy T.

customer_reviews.title: Gift for my teenage son
customer_reviews.text: My teenage son requested this for Christmas. He is very happy with it and the graphics card seems to be a very good one. I don't know much about computer parts, but it seems excellent. It shipped quickly and arrived safely. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: PLD

customer_reviews.title: Crisp graphics!
customer_reviews.text: Well worth it under $200. Insane graphics just passed most new games recommendation. Great clock speed. Everything is smooth after isntall. A must get graphic card!
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Great cards
customer_reviews.text: Great cards, i have two on them in SLI and the breeze thru any game like guild wars 2, grid 2, tomb raider 2013, planetside 2 blacklight retribution, hawken, all of them in MAX settings at 60 fps, they rarely drop, only when things get extremely frantic (say planetside 2 huge scale battle sorrounded by explosions and all that) but when they do they dont drop below 50 fps
customer_reviews.author: Angelpunk18

customer_reviews.title: Great card, fast.
customer_reviews.text: Handles these games on Ultra/high: All Total War series Borderlands 2 Battlefield 3 Sims Medieval I'll probably keep it around for a long time. Great card.
customer_reviews.author: Arock

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Card for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I have used this on a high end xeon business / cad computer since March of 2013 and it is excellent. I occasionally play games with it too. Super quiet and reliable card. I'm pushing three monitors with the card with zero issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for our son to build his ness per PC it is awesome. The graphics are amazing nada the games he runs are very detailed now. He can also quickly render his video edits with clarity and full detail this was a very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Works well playing all games, didn't realize what I ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well playing all games, didn't realize what I was missing until my video card was upgraded! Had to upgrade my power supply as well-- worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: This graphics card will run any game to date with ease. With the steady flow of updates too it only gets better. I bought this a few months ago and plan on keeping this card in my PC for a while. It should keep up with games for a couple years. It is very quiet and also stays very cool, even when running at full capacity.
customer_reviews.author: smills827

customer_reviews.title: Great brand and great product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent budget gpu. I am able to play all games at atleast high at 1080p while paired with a i5 2500k. Good temps, and great look. you will not regret this purchase Note: sli works well with these. Great future upgrade investment.
customer_reviews.author: jelling

customer_reviews.title: GTX 660 superclocked
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card to play the latest games on high settings. I can play crysis 2 on highest settings and I'm using pci express 2.0 instead of 3.0 for the time being. The gtx 660 is a great graphics card for a low budget gaming pc. Sorry, I dont know my frame rates on crysis 2 but there was no lag. EDIT- I now have a motherboard with pci-e 3.0 and get 48-60 fps on crysis 2 maxed out settings and 45-60 fps while recording with fraps. Max settings min-max Crysis 2 48-60 fps Garry's mod 125-306 fps Lost planet extreme conditions 65-125 fps 75 degrees Celsius on maximum load, idle 29 degrees Celsius.
customer_reviews.author: havoc1991

customer_reviews.title: The good is the EVGA warranty
customer_reviews.text: I dont speack english I use translator unfortunately the first that buy the video card was damaged but EVGA replace me for other, and from there everything ok. I live in Ecuador, and shipped to California for the RMA is expensive. $60 dolares more Not if the store, but most of what I bought is defective
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Silent beast
customer_reviews.text: When I first ordered this card I had received one with a broken fan. It had been dislodged somehow most likely during transit. Called up the nice folks at Amazon and by 11am the next day a replacement had arrived in perfect condition. The card is simply awesome. A huge upgrade from my 260. I can max out every game I play with no FPS drops whatsoever. The sound that comes from the card is almost non-existent. The temps are so cool too. I plan to eventually get another one and SLI it. If you want bang for your buck this card is it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this graphics card in one of my computers for a few years now. Sill going strong and works great for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Scott J.

customer_reviews.title: Great video card
customer_reviews.text: This card does a great job. It's the best card you can get at this price. The SuperClock feature gives it a good power increase, and you can still OC it higher if you want. The Boost feature is nice to keep your card running at its best. EVGA has great customer support, and a great warranty. I definitely recommend this card to anyone looking to upgrade to a fast, quality card at a great price range.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, running 4 screens off my Hackintosh
customer_reviews.text: Amazing card. My first GTX6xx series card and I'm beyond impressed. It's running 4 screens off my Hackintosh. Almost plug and play, I have 7200x4260 resolution with 113" of monitors going. I'm seeing a little bit of lag at 4 monitors when doing a lot of stuff like watching a movie, having a bunch of browsers with animations, programs, etc but it was at 150% speed with 3 monitors (one of which is 2560x1440). Honestly, just really really impressed. I have no need for the 4th monitor, especially a 42", but it's cool that it can.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: EVGA GeForce GTX 660 SUPERCLOCKED
customer_reviews.text: this product is worth the price it i installed it on my friends PC and now am jealous of his system it runs medal of honor at very high quality and other high demanding graphics game sweet no regrets
customer_reviews.author: boomba

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy form this vendor
customer_reviews.text: Got a dead card, was x-mas present for my son, it didn't work at all, Amazon sided with vendor
customer_reviews.author: Agustin Saldate

customer_reviews.title: have had card for about a year now but seems ...
customer_reviews.text: have had card for about a year now but seems to be really buggy..... works tho just crashes a lot during sleep
customer_reviews.author: StraightEdgeRik

customer_reviews.title: Just pure performance
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Gpu for a month. Easy installation, good apps from Evga, comes with VGA adapter and works great. I 've been using it sometimes maybe for 5 or 6 hours straight, playing battlefield 4 or AC4 and the temperature never goes more than 50C. It's SLI compatible for future upgrades, it is cheap and will give you a steady 60 fps without dropping even once. At least mine doesn't ;p Make sure your cpu doesn't bottleneck this baby ! ~peace
customer_reviews.author: Soutsos

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: With a moderate overclock this guy is +-5% of my GTX 580s performance. In synthetics it is crushing, but in actual game performance I am seeing equal or slightly lower performance (2-4 FPS). It's doing this at much less power consumption, even with the added OC. Runs a little hotter than expected (80c under stress with fan @ 65%, which is the highest I found that was still very quiet) - I had read I should expect low to mid 60s. Temps are with the bump up though. It is great value for the money. I came back here to grab another for SLI and decided I would post a review.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Was very disappointed. Tried contacting Evga to find out the problem ...
customer_reviews.text: Sorry this card didn't last me 1 yr. Was working well, then one day only to find out there was no video signal for either ports on the card. Was very disappointed. Tried contacting Evga to find out the problem nothing worked. The fan seemed very quiet of the time of use. Now its very loud. Just don't know what to do.
customer_reviews.author: Sega

customer_reviews.title: Excellent graphic card.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent graphic card. Bought this as an upgrade for my Alienware X51 (330W PSU) and had no problem at all even after a month. Card fits well in the casing. It's less noisy and run at a lower temperature compared to the graphics card (Nvidia Geforce 555) that originally came with the Alienware X51. Very satisfied purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Johnson Lim

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and powerful
customer_reviews.text: I received the card in 2 days, and no issues whatsoever. I highly recommend the card to anyone considering the standard card. It even has Overclocking and Benchmark software with it.
customer_reviews.author: GSX16

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Graphics card, better tham more expensive ones!
customer_reviews.text: Great Graphics card for the price! Can max out any game with over 80+fps alot of times i get over 130fps! on BF3 i get around 145 steady fps! Would recommend over similar products.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Kay

product_meta.title: EVGA GeForce GTX 660 SUPERCLOCKED 2048MB GDDR5 DVI HDMI DP Graphics Card 02G-P4-2662-KR
product_meta.description: Get the weapon of choice for gamers - the EVGA GeForce GTX 660. It takes NVIDIA Kepler-powered graphics cards to new levels of affordability while retaining class-leading performance and power efficiency, making it a must-have upgrade for today's hottest games. The EVGA GeForce GTX 660 graphics card represents the Kepler "sweet spot" for gamers - the ultimate combination of performance, power efficiency, and affordability.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars507 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
